headline: Democrats embrace Dick Cheney during Jan. 6 remembrance event
author: Brett Bachman
sentences: It would have been an odd scene just a few years ago: Congressional Democrats lining up to greet and exchange kind words with former vice president Dick Cheney, who along with his daughter, Rep. Liz Cheney, were the only two Republican members present for an event held at the U.S. Capitol Thursday to commemorate the attempted Jan. 6 insurrection.

During a Thursday interview with The New York Times' "The Daily" podcast, she doubled down on her criticism of current Republican Party leadership and made headlines for confirming a long-known rumor about the way she chewed out fellow GOP Rep. Jim Jordan, R-Oh, for his role in laying the groundwork for Jan. 6.

Liz Cheney is in the middle of ramping up a bitterly contested primary campaign to hold onto her Wyoming congressional seat in the face of opposition from pro-Trump forces who have labeled her as an enemy for publicly opposing the former president's attempts to overturn the 2020 election results.
